Charm Engineering Releases

Charm Engineering Releases

 

This page catalogues releases from charm engineering teams. Its content automatically generated every 15 minutes by querying the Github API and scraping Launchpad pages. The data is generated using releasegen.

  • For a release to show here, it must be part of one of the specified Github Teams or Launchpad project groups. Github projects must not be Archived, Launchpad projects are scraped for tags. The latest three releases are shown for each repository.

    For GitHub badges to be shown for your repository, add them in the README; similarly, to display the extra CharmHub release information in the expanding table rows, add the CharmHub badge ( ![](https://charmhub.io/*charm-name*/badge.svg) ) to your charm's README.

RepositoryLatest Releases/CommitStatusCommits Since
lru

v1.0.0 on Jul 20, 2022

lru

Release/Commit:v1.0.0
DateJul 20, 2022

Go mod


Up to date
bundlechanges

v2.0.0 on Aug 18, 2020

bundlechanges

Release/Commit:v2.0.0
DateAug 18, 2020

Merge pull request #65 from SimonRichardson/charm-dependencies

https://github.com/juju/bundlechanges/pull/65

As the charm brings in dependency breaking changes (prefix for bundles are required), this ensures that all consumers of this library are fully exposed to the fact that the underlying charm and charmrepo changes are breaking changes and I’m forcing bundlechanges users to understand this.

The number of changes inside go mod and sum are a bit concerning, but all the tests pass, so I’m inclined to leave it as-is for now.

v1.0.0 on Jun 25, 2020

bundlechanges

Release/Commit:v1.0.0
DateJun 25, 2020

Merge pull request #64 from SimonRichardson/deterministic-master

https://github.com/juju/bundlechanges/pull/64

The following ensure that the applications that we loop through are deterministic, so that when adding application units we skip correctly with in the loop.

This is fixing LP #1883645

1.0.1 on Jun 25, 2020

bundlechanges

Release/Commit:1.0.1
DateJun 25, 2020

Merge pull request #64 from SimonRichardson/deterministic-master

https://github.com/juju/bundlechanges/pull/64

The following ensure that the applications that we loop through are deterministic, so that when adding application units we skip correctly with in the loop.

This is fixing LP #1883645

4 commits
ansiterm

v1.0.0 on Sep 29, 2021

ansiterm

Release/Commit:v1.0.0
DateSep 29, 2021

What’s Changed

  • Initial proposal for juju inclusion. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/1
  • Expose the Init and Flush tabwriter methods. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/2
  • Check for dumb TERM vars, and add method to explicitly set color. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/3
  • Make individual columns able to be right aligned. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/4
  • Fix index out of range panic. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/5
  • Add missing LICENSE file by @aviau in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/6
  • Fix small typo in NewTabWriter comment details by @paddymorgan84 in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/7
  • Color Writer: NO_COLOR support by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/8

New Contributors

  • @howbazaar made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/1
  • @cmars made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/5
  • @aviau made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/6
  • @paddymorgan84 made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/7
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/pull/8

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/ansiterm/commits/v1.0.0

v1.0.0 on Jul 28, 2021

loggo

Release/Commit:v1.0.0
DateJul 28, 2021

What’s Changed

  • Split up logger.go and writer.go. by @ericsnowcurrently in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/14
  • Support non-global loggers. by @ericsnowcurrently in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/13
  • Cleans up package abstractions by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/17
  • Protect write operations with a muxtex by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/18
  • Missing mutex in public method. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/19
  • Add a color writer and make it the new default. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/20
  • Move ANSI terminal color support into loggocolor by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/25
  • Adding the missing . in the comments ;) by @mohsen0 in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/26
  • Fix master by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/28
  • Add Parent and Child methods to the Logger type. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/30
  • Update docs. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/31
  • Add ability to set color capability on loggocolor by @makyo in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/34
  • Move ConfigureLoggers to the Context struct. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/36
  • Add ability to get Root logger from any Logger. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/38
  • Logger: Label loggers by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/40
  • Logging config for new loggers by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/43
  • Add GetLoggerWithLabels function by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/45

New Contributors

  • @ericsnowcurrently made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/14
  • @wallyworld made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/18
  • @mohsen0 made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/26
  • @makyo made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/34
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/40
  • @hmlanigan made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/45

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/loggo/commits/v1.0.0

v6.0.1 on Feb 7, 2022

charmrepo

Release/Commit:v6.0.1
DateFeb 7, 2022

What’s Changed

  • Use latest version of charm/v8 that uses juju/os/v2 by @benhoyt in https://github.com/juju/charmrepo/pull/164
  • Allow custom user agent value by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/charmrepo/pull/168
  • Use github.com/go-macaroon-bakery/v3 instead of gopkg.in/macaroon-bakery.v2 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/charmrepo/pull/171
  • Use gopkg.in/maaroon-bakery.v3 instead of github.com/go-macaroon-bakery/macaroon-bakery/v3 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/charmrepo/pull/173
  • Revert “Merge pull request #173 from wallyworld/use-bakery-v3” by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/charmrepo/pull/177
  • Move charmstore related tests to a separate subpackage by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/charmrepo/pull/179
  • Backport meta method support by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/charmrepo/pull/185
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/charmrepo/pull/186
  • Tweak upstream deps to latest versions by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/charmrepo/pull/187

New Contributors

  • @benhoyt made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/charmrepo/pull/164

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/charmrepo/compare/6.0.0…v6.0.1

errors

v1.0.0 on Jun 22, 2022

errors

Release/Commit:v1.0.0
DateJun 22, 2022

What’s Changed

  • fixes LP 1580391 by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/25
  • Print the stack trace when formatting with %+v by @mkmik in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/28
  • Add forbidden error by @geoffreybauduin in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/30
  • misspell fix on functions.go by @hiveminded in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/31
  • Simplify slice definition by @spring1843 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/32
  • Update for lander. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/35
  • add timeout err by @gertcuykens in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/34
  • made getgopath more accurate by @ycliuhw in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/36
  • typo by @temoto in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/37
  • fix Err.Format by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/38
  • Fix typo by @spring1843 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/39
  • Start comments with the name of the element it describes by @spring1843 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/33
  • configurable source trim prefix, default $GOPATH/src by @temoto in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/43
  • docs: fix typos by @Jason-Cooke in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/44
  • Introduce QuotaLimitExceeded error by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/45
  • Define NotYetAvailable error type by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/48
  • Refresh deps and use go 1.17 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/49
  • [JUJU-710] Removes juju/testing from requires. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/51
  • [JUJU-753] Add Err.Unwrap to support standard error library (Go 1.13+) by @barrettj12 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/52
  • [JUJU-754] Updates SetLocation functionality to work with mod. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/53
  • [JUJU-790] Add GitHub Action to run go test by @barrettj12 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/55
  • [JUJU-759] Change error types to use new ConstError by @barrettj12 in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/54
  • Fixes panics found in Juju for nil errors. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/56
  • Independent SetLocation and WithType for errors. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/57
  • [JUJU-1339] Adds a shush method to the library and IsType. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/59
  • Adds support for a new convenience function AsType and HasType. by @tlm in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/60

New Contributors

  • @mkmik made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/28
  • @geoffreybauduin made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/30
  • @hiveminded made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/31
  • @spring1843 made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/errors/pull/32

Up to date
http

v2.0.0 on Jun 15, 2022

http

Release/Commit:v2.0.0
DateJun 15, 2022

What’s Changed

  • Code for the juju http wrapper package. by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/1
  • Replace contents of http.Request to add trace features. by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/2
  • Fix NewClient overwriting http.DefaultClient’s Jar field by @benhoyt in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/3
  • Client: Refactor client by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/4
  • Add client option to record outgoing requests by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/5
  • Retry round tripper by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/6
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/7
  • [JUJU-1119] Do not allow http pkg to cache proxy settings. by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/8
  • Re-enable HTTP keep-alives now that net/http is fixed (as of Go 1.6!) by @benhoyt in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/10
  • Add GitHub Actions workflow to run tests (and check formatting) by @benhoyt in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/11

New Contributors

  • @hmlanigan made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/1
  • @benhoyt made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/3
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/4
  • @achilleasa made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/5
  • @wallyworld made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/http/pull/7

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/http/commits/v2.0.0

jsonschema

v1.0.0 on Feb 7, 2022

jsonschema

Release/Commit:v1.0.0
DateFeb 7, 2022

What’s Changed

  • initial code by @natefinch in https://github.com/juju/jsonschema/pull/1
  • Update schema based on actual usage by @natefinch in https://github.com/juju/jsonschema/pull/2
  • Convert to go mod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/jsonschema/pull/3
  • Tweak updatream deps to latest versions by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/jsonschema/pull/4

  • @natefinch made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/jsonschema/pull/1
  • @wallyworld made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/jsonschema/pull/3

v3.6.9 on Aug 12, 2025

juju

Release/Commit:Juju 3.6.9
DateAug 12, 2025

The Juju team is proud to release Juju 3.6.9!

This is a point release to the stable 3.6 series of Juju.

Checkout the Juju 3.6.9 Release Notes

What’s Changed

  • chore: merge 2.9 to 3.5 by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/19280
  • docs: fix linkcheck by @tmihoc in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/19974
  • docs: fix loal typo by @st3v3nmw in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/19898
  • chore: upgrade description v9 by @kian99 in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20039
  • fix: don’t flush model when we have no machines by @adisazhar123 in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20029
  • fix: followup PR to set controllerUUID in missed places by @adisazhar123 in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20057
  • chore: add target token field to migration spec by @kian99 in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20085
  • fix: machine loopback addresses not being accounted by @sombrafam in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/19998
  • feat: add aws and azure regions by @adisazhar123 in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20087
  • fix: inefficient security group client side filtering by @adisazhar123 in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/19954
  • feat: support import-filesystem for k8s by @jneo8 in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/19904
  • fix: reduce charm memory constraints and fill workload container requests by @CodingCookieRookie in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20014
  • feat(docs): add automatic Excalidraw to SVG conversion by @anvial in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20060
  • docs: add 2.9.52 release notes by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20139
  • docs: add 3.6.8 release notes by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20140

  • chore: reword CVE commit message by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20154
  • Move k8s-attach-storage feature flag from controller to cli by @jneo8 in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20157
  • docs: add reference doc for missing introspection commands by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20104
  • chore: fix machine startup race in tests by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20138
  • fix: azure prem storage pending indefinitely by @CodingCookieRookie in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20122
  • chore(docs): only convert modified excalidraw files by @anvial in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20183

  • feat: new retry strategy and better logging for upgrade step by @adisazhar123 in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20248
  • fix: issue upgrading a k8s controller by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20116
  • fix: make adding a disk to a lxd container idempotent by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/juju/pull/20269

Up to date
pubsub

v2.0.0 on Feb 7, 2022

pubsub

Release/Commit:v2.0.0
DateFeb 7, 2022

What’s Changed

  • Initial import of pubsub branch for review. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/1
  • Simplify the types to remove Topic and Unsubscriber. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/4
  • Error response changed in latest go versions. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/5
  • Fix the deadlock in the multiplexer by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/6
  • Add dependencies.tsv and update Makefile. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/7
  • Make creating a subscriber only log at trace level by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/8

  • Add a multiplexer for the simple hub. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/10
  • Publish wait by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/pubsub/pull/12

4 commits
python-libjuju

3.6.1.3 on Jul 11, 2025

python-libjuju

Release/Commit:3.6.1.3 - Mind your Ps and Qs
DateJul 11, 2025

This release of python-libjuju fixes a nasty bug where trailing ‘P’, ‘Q’, and ‘=’ characters were stripped from secret values. This is a good reminder to migrate your charm’s Juju integration tests to jubilant if possible.

Note that python-libjuju is not under active development, and will only receive critical bugfixes and security fixes for Juju 3.6. There are no plans to support Juju 4.0, so please migrate to jubilant.

What’s Changed

  • fix: don’t strip valid characters from secret data by @james-garner-canonical in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1276
  • chore: release 3.6.1.3 by @james-garner-canonical in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1278

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/compare/3.6.1.2…3.6.1.3

python-libjuju

7 commits
retry

v1.0.1 on Sep 16, 2024

retry

Release/Commit:v1.0.1
DateSep 16, 2024

What’s Changed

This is a small bugfix update from previous versions, though there is one small behavioral change.

The primary fix is that previously if you did ExpBackoff(min=1.0, max=200, factor=2.0, jitter=false), then the times would be in the expected 1.0, 2.0, 4.0. Up to the max. However, when you set jitter=true, while it would preserve the maximum to be the same time as the original backoff, it would pick a random value from 0ms to the max delay, and then truncate that to the minDelay. Which meant that it actually changed the average wait time to something close to 50% of the expected times.

The new logic does a +/- 20% from the expected delay, and then caps that at min and max. This averages very close to the expected values (in testing, the over time difference is around a 1% shift.)

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/retry/compare/v1.0.0…v1.0.1## What’s Changed * fix: cleanup our handling of jitter and other misc by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/retry/pull/12

v1.0.0 on Feb 4, 2022

retry

Release/Commit:v1.0.0
DateFeb 4, 2022

What’s Changed

  • Use juju/clock. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/retry/pull/6
  • Implement exponential back-off delay generator by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/retry/pull/7
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/retry/pull/8

New Contributors

  • Handle the error return from utils.SetHome(). by @ericsnowcurrently in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/97
  • testing: add TCPProxy.CloseConns by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/98
  • mgo: don’t panic while resetting admin password by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/99
  • Don’t drop and recreate the database between tests by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/100
  • testing: don’t panic during TearDownTest if SetUpTest failed by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/101
  • Added BSONEquals checker by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/103
  • Detect mongod version before starting test server by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/104
  • lp:1596045 handle CRLF in mongo version line by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/105
  • copy clock from juju/juju/testing by @jrwren in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/106
  • Update to use the latest loggo. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/107
  • Retry mgo dial if unexpected message. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/109
  • Hook up mgo logging and reconnect properly. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/110
  • add NewProxiedSession by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/111
  • implement Clock.NewTimer by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/108
  • Bump mongo error output to 100 lines by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/112
  • Update testing.Clock to improve robustness by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/113
  • NewProxiedSession - ping to assign a socket to the returned session. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/114
  • checkers: ignore time zone in DeepEqual by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/115
  • MongoDB needs –key=value not –key value now by @dooferlad in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/116
  • Fixes for replicaset by @macgreagoir in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/117
  • Introduces a type which can be used to mock calls by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/118
  • tcpproxy: add pause and resume to the stream by @mhilton in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/119
  • Disable mgo logging/debugging by default by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/120
  • Mongo 3.4 uses a different string to indicate it is ready for connections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/121
  • Fix EchoQuotedArgsUnix/AssertEchoArgs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/122
  • Fix PatchExecutableAsEchoArgs on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/124
  • Prefer mongod 3.2 and improve mongod info caching by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/123
  • Default mongo storage backend to mmapv1 by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/126
  • Add MgoInstance.SSLEnabled method by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/125
  • Remove deprecated –sslOnNormalPorts arg to mongod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/127
  • Fix typo in mongo command by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/128
  • Stub check calls without order. by @anastasiamac in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/132
  • testing: default to mmapv1 only on x86(_64) by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/133
  • Don’t try to truncate the local replicaset oplog. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/135
  • Changes to support Mongo 3.6. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/136
  • Expose the version of Mongo that we are testing against. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/137
  • enable vendor as the highest priority import path by @ycliuhw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/138
  • Add short and long timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/139
  • Use juju/clock by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/140
  • Add the location of mongod in bionic to the list of places we look. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/141
  • Enable Mongo with Replica Sets by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/142
  • If using Replicaset use wiredTiger. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/143
  • Add support for finding the juju-db snap when looking for mongod by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/144
  • Allow testing of DoRequest against status code by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/145
  • Malformed errors by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/146
  • Fix address already in use detection. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/147
  • Move to go mod + fix juju-db snap usage by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/148
  • Fix issue with juju suites overwriting HOME by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/149
  • Sidestep HOME env var for juju-db snap testing by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/150
  • Add multi-checker by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/151
  • Add go style expressions for multichecker matching. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/152
  • Upgrade juju/utils package to v2 by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/153
  • Fix performance issue with using collstats. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/154
  • Only use mmapv1 args for mmap storage engine by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/155
  • Only use maxTransactionLockRequestTimeoutMillis for mongo 4 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/156
  • Update to use juju/mgo/v2 repo by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/158
  • Ensure that the namespaced collections in the logs db are removed during teardown. by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/160
  • Allow suites that depend on MgoSuite to disable cleanup. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/162
  • Update to use utils/v3 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/163
  • Upstream dep updates by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/164

v2.0.0 on Jul 8, 2022

txn

Release/Commit:v2.0.0
DateJul 8, 2022

What’s Changed

  • Expose PruneTxns in order to allow external tools to use it by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/16
  • Add progress logging while pruning transactions by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/17
  • Retry errors that finish with ‘unexpected message’. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • Add export_test.go by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/19
  • Use mgo.Collection.Bulk to prune docs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/20
  • Add RunTransaction observer by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/21
  • Use disk-based pruning strategy by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/22
  • Make prune log output consistent by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/23
  • Cleanup txn.Stash as part of regular pruning by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • Cleanup all collections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/25
  • Don’t create transactions that have no operations. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/27
  • Abstract out “Completed Transaction” functionality by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/26
  • Properly test no-op does the right thing, as does real errors. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/28
  • Add a command-line utility to clean and purge txns. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • Add logging information about the pruning result. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/29
  • Turns out it isn’t safe to use aggregation in 2.4 at all. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/31
  • support using RemoveAll($in) instead of Bulk. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/32
  • Various cleanups by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/35
  • track what is actually removed by Oracle.RemoveTxns() by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/34
  • Expose a NewestTime for PruneOptions. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/36
  • Handle Bulk.Run() result being nil by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/37
  • When observing transactions include the run Duration. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/40
  • Change Clock back to being optional. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/41
  • Allow passing in a parameter to limit the number of transactions evaluated by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/42
  • Expose the batch size and number of batches. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/43
  • No need for uint64 and it makes default printing ugly by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/44
  • Use juju/clock package for the clock. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/45
  • Incremental prune by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/46
  • 2.4 prune options by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/47
  • Pass the transaction attempt by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • Revert “Merge pull request #48 from SimonRichardson/txn-attempt” by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/51
  • Add testing.SetFailIfTransaction. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/49
  • Retry i/o timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/52
  • Thread through the transaction by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/50
  • juju/txn with server side transactions by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/55
  • Add help text to explain why hooks do not run by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • Properly handle when RemoveAll returns an error. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/57
  • Use github.com/juju/mgo/v2 and convert to go mod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/58
  • Add extra txn backoff tuning parameters for sstxn by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/59
  • Make retry fuzz a percent and use durations instead of floats by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/60
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/61
  • Add support for no change log, used when upgrading to SSTXN. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

New Contributors

  • @howbazaar made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • @jameinel made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • @cmars made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30

juju-restore

v0.14 on Feb 3, 2023

juju-restore

Release/Commit:juju-restore v0.14
DateFeb 3, 2023

Add support for cloning secret backend rotations to the –copy-controller option. See https://github.com/juju/juju-restore/pull/25 .

v0.13 on Jan 19, 2023

juju-restore

Release/Commit:juju-restore v0.13
DateJan 19, 2023

Add support for cloning secret backends to the --copy-controller option. See #24 .

v0.12 on Nov 16, 2022

juju-restore

Release/Commit:juju-restore v0.12
DateNov 16, 2022

Add a new --copy-controller option to initialise a new controller to look like a backed up controller. This is useful when setting up a controller for a newer Juju version and copying to that new controller users, clouds, and config from an existing controller. See #23.

Release/Commit:Revision 156

Release/Commit:caution accessing unit databags in Coordinator
DateJul 31, 2025

Works around an elusive (juju/ops?) issue where looping through relation.units and attempting relation.data[unit] would raise an exception.

Up to date
charm-relation-interfaces

fe2252d on Aug 7, 2025

charm-relation-interfaces

Release/Commit:fe2252d
DateAug 7, 2025

ci: let matrix tests run for a single interface from a PR branch (#292)

This PR moves the logic to invoke the matrix tests for an individual interface to a reusable workflow, and allows specifying the repository and branch to fetch the test and interface definitions from. This will allow the tests added by a PR to be (manually) run in the CI context before merging, instead of only being able to test them locally.

62924f4 on Nov 7, 2024

lightkube-extensions

Release/Commit:62924f4
DateNov 7, 2024

fix: handle case where get_deployed_resources is called on a resource_type not in cluster (#3)

During teardown, especially when destroying a model, we can have a race condition where resource_type’s owner may have already been deleted and thus the resource_type CRD has been removed. For that reason, ignore 404 errors here and just proceed to the next resource.

calico-rocks

bf2d9e8 on Jul 23, 2025

calico-rocks

Release/Commit:bf2d9e8
DateJul 23, 2025

feat: pin k8s-test-harness (#4)

4122057 on Dec 6, 2024

calico-rocks

Release/Commit:4122057
DateDec 6, 2024

Drop custom tigera operator patches (#3)

The Tigera operator expects the ImageSet specs to contain the original image names, not the custom ones. We’ll drop our custom patches and update the integration tests accordingly.

We need to remove “calico-ctl” from the image spec as the Tigera operator does not expect it and is going to throw an error.

While at it, we’ll avoid using the “match” expression since it’s unsupported on 22.04.

33f3dff on Sep 20, 2024

calico-rocks

Release/Commit:33f3dff
DateSep 20, 2024

Add calico rock definitions (#1)

DateNov 6, 2024

What’s Changed

  • Prevent panicing when NodeRef is not set when deleting a machine by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #65
  • Call Dqlite remove endpoint for cleanup (KU-1719) by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #69
  • Spawn a pod to make request to cluster-agent by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #71
  • Handle upgrade pod already exists by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #73

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/cluster-api-control-plane-provider-microk8s/compare/v0.6.10…v0.6.11

The test will also check the Pod probes to make sure that the service is up, without waiting for Kubernetes to do the check.

The test will also spawn a NFS server, and create an NGINX Pod requiring a NFS volume.

falco-rocks

43c1690 on Feb 18, 2025

Release/Commit:43c1690

Co-authored-by: renovate[bot] <29139614+renovate[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>

2aff977 on Nov 5, 2024

falco-rocks

Release/Commit:2aff977
DateNov 5, 2024

Changes falcosidekick and falcosidekick-ui rock bases to bare (#21)

Switching to a bare-based image will reduce the overall image size and reduces attack surface area.

We can no longer use ensure_image_contains_paths to check if files exist in the rock images, since they are now bare-based. Instead, we can use ensure_image_contains_paths_bare, which checks the image layers instead. Because of this, we need sufficient permissions to check the /var/lib/docker folder.

Adds additional check for falcosidekick-ui during the integration test.

17 commits
k8s-microcluster

v2.1.0 on Aug 15, 2024

k8s-microcluster

Release/Commit:v2.1.0
DateAug 15, 2024

Change project name detection on prepare statements (#2)

Any changes to the folder/repository causes an issue with statement registrations, to address this the hard coded name is updated to use the caller project.

v2.0.2 on Aug 6, 2024

k8s-microcluster

Release/Commit:v2.0.2
DateAug 6, 2024

Add back legacy /cluster/internal/database endpoint (#224)

We renamed /cluster/internal, /cluster/control, and /cluster/1.0 to /core/... but this leads to an issue when upgrading from v1 to v2 where the newer members cannot connect to dqlite until all un-upgraded members are offline. This is because the dqlite leader will still be communicating over /cluster/internal/database.

This makes upgrades noticeably slower, while also undoing the work we had done earlier to show upgrade progress with the cluster list command, because we can’t connect to dqlite to inspect the schema versions. Instead, the daemon just reports Database is still starting because the dqlite connection cannot be established. The upgrade still does work, it just takes an additional 30-60s or so because the upgraded daemons will be constantly restarting until all cluster members have been upgraded.

To work around this, we can add back /cluster/internal/database as a core API endpoint. For the most part, this won’t be used, as it will only be relevant while upgrading from an existing setup that uses the old API endpoints. This path will be reserved so extension servers cannot use /cluster/internal/database as a path.

Functionally, when establishing a connection to dqlite, if we encounter a 404 error on /core/internal/database, we will try /cluster/internal/database as a fallback, allowing us to connect to legacy systems to compare schema versions.

Rather than adding this to v3 and backporting to v2, I thought we might as well fully drop the legacy support from v3 since it likely won’t be released for some time, meaning direct upgrades from v1->v3 should be rather sparse. And since this doesn’t actually affect the result of an upgrade, I don’t think it’s worth the extra maintenance.

v2.0.1 on Aug 2, 2024

k8s-microcluster

Release/Commit:v2.0.1
DateAug 2, 2024

(backport v2) Parse go module version out of project name (#221)

This helper finds microcluster among the cached build files to register internal statements. Since microcluster’s module path has been appended with v2, this function now resolves to v2 as the project name instead of microcluster, so this commit properly checks if the path is of the form v[number] and if so, looks one directory back instead.

This should fix external projects failing to register internal microcluster prepared statements.

Signed-off-by: Max Asnaashari max.asnaashari@canonical.com (cherry picked from commit aaec49fa6823ddf8802336b3affbbe8878cc6a52)

Up to date
k8s-test-harness

de46217 on Oct 25, 2024

k8s-test-harness

Release/Commit:de46217
DateOct 25, 2024

Adds function for checking files on bare-based images (#36)

Currently, we can only check if files exist on regular images by starting a container and running ls. Bare-based images do not have that option.

This adds ensure_image_contains_paths_bare function, which will allow us to check bare-based images if they have the given set of file paths. This functions checks the image layers for those files, and makes sure it wasn’t deleted (replaced by a whiteout file).

3ecf830 on Oct 14, 2024

k8s-test-harness

Release/Commit:3ecf830
DateOct 14, 2024

Adds install mutating pebble webhook util function (#35)

Some helm charts deploy pods / charts with readOnlyRootFilesystem=True daemonsets or deployments, which means Pebble won’t be able to copy its necessary files. This mutating webhook solves this issue by adding an emptydir volume to Pods for Pebble to use.

7831e6d on Oct 2, 2024

k8s-test-harness

Release/Commit:7831e6d
DateOct 2, 2024

k8s_util: Describe resources from all namespaces (#34)

On error, we describe resources. However, we only describe the ones in the default namespace, which isn’t typically used in tests.

Instead, we could describe the resources from all namespaces.

longhorn-rocks

4eb2f4e on Jul 23, 2025

longhorn-rocks

Release/Commit:4eb2f4e
DateJul 23, 2025

feat: pin k8s-test-harness (#37)

80f94fc on Oct 24, 2024

longhorn-rocks

Release/Commit:80f94fc
DateOct 24, 2024

Adds arm64 to rock images (#36)

  • Adds arm64 to rock images

Previously, we’ve skipped adding support for arm64 since some of the rocks failed to build for arm64.

  • Fixes longhorn-manager arm64 rocks

The iputils snap does nto have an arm64 target, so we can’t use that for arm64.

The iputils rpm from suse (installed in the original Dockerfile) contains the following binaries: arping, clockdiff, ping, tracepath. It also contains symlinks for ping6 and tracepath6.

We’ll be installing equivalent apt packages for those binaries to keep parity.

  • Fixes v1.7.0 longhorn-engine and longhorn-instance-manager arm64 rocks

When building tgt, we’re getting this error on arm64:

bs.c: In function ‘bs_sig_request_done’:
bs.c:196:15: error: ‘read’ writing 1 byte into a region of size 0 overflows the destination [-Werror=stringop-overflow=]
  196 |         ret = read(fd, (char *)siginfo, sizeof(siginfo));
      |               ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
bs.c:193:33: note: destination object ‘siginfo’ of size 0
  193 |         struct signalfd_siginfo siginfo[16];
      |                                 ^~~~~~~
In file included from /usr/include/unistd.h:1217,
                 from bs.c:33:
/usr/include/aarch64-linux-gnu/bits/unistd.h:26:1: note: in a call to function ‘read’ declared with attribute ‘access (write_only, 2)’
   26 | read (int __fd, void *__buf, size_t __nbytes)
      | ^~~~
cc1: all warnings being treated as errors
make[1]: *** [Makefile:95: bs.o] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory '/root/parts/build-tgt/build/usr'
make: *** [Makefile:24: programs] Error 2
'override-build' in part 'build-tgt' failed with code 2.

After some investigation, it seems that this Warning is not a false positive. Because # if defined(__NR_signalfd) is false, signalfd_siginfo is an empty structure, which means that siginfo is actually an array of elements that have 0 bytes in size. It seems that on arm64, there’s only __NR_signalfd4, not __NR_signalfd.

Interestingly, this does not occur on ubuntu 22.04, which is why we’re not seeing this issue in the v1.6.2 rocks.

xref: https://www.spinics.net/lists/linux-stgt/msg04783.html

This patch is a cherry-pick of the following commit (+ resolved conflicts), which solves this issue:

https://github.com/fujita/tgt/commit/7ea559753e647e6a5fa5a0ca3c29ba417d9744b7

c5f9bbb on Sep 24, 2024

longhorn-rocks

v1.33 on Apr 18, 2025

microk8s

Release/Commit:MicroK8s 1.33 released!
DateApr 18, 2025

In this release

Kubernetes 1.33

Read more at https://kubernetes.io/blog/2025/04/23/kubernetes-v1-33-release/

Bugfixes

  • fix: run iptables as sudo on microk8s stop by @berkayoz in #5021
  • fix: Always refresh the default hooks during upgrades by @petrutlucian94 in #5009
  • fix: flush the CNI-HOSTPORT-DNAT chain on stop by @berkayoz in #4963
  • fix: update configure hook to add a newline before adding watchlist flag by @berkayoz in #4946
  • Cleanup common non-namespaced resources (Closes #4747) by @LoniasGR in #4779
  • scripts: Fix kill-host-pods script by @HomayoonAlimohammadi in #4835
  • kill-host-pods.py: filter pods by node by @petrutlucian94 in #4819
  • fix: Catches KeyError while enabling SRIOV addon by @Gmerold in #249

Updates

  • Bump component versions by @petrutlucian94 in #4981
  • snapcraft.yaml: upgrade to libmnl-1.0.5 by @xypron in #4849
  • chore: bump go version to 1.24 by @berkayoz in #5049
  • Update addon versions by @petrutlucian94 in #318
  • fix: update ingress-nginx to 1.12.1 by @berkayoz in #327
  • cert-manager: Update to v1.17.1 by @claudiubelu in #334
  • Update dashboard to 7.11.1 by @claudiubelu in #335
  • metallb: Update addon to v1.14.9 by @claudiubelu in #336
  • kube-ovn: Upgrade to v1.13.8 by @claudiubelu in #338
  • Update observability addon to the latest versions by @claudiubelu in #339
  • rook-ceph: Update addon to v1.16.6 by @claudiubelu in #340
  • nvidia: Update addon helm charts to the latest versions by @claudiubelu in #342
  • feat: update addons versions and update list by @berkayoz in #344
  • Dns domain argument by @TecIntelli in #258

Release Specific Changes

  • chore: add updated patches for kubernetes v1.33 by @berkayoz in #5048
  • fix: update strict patches for runc 1.2.6 by @berkayoz in #5031

Many thanks to our contributors

v1.31 on Aug 14, 2024

microk8s

Release/Commit:MicroK8s 1.31 released!
DateAug 14, 2024

In this release

Kubernetes 1.31

Read more at https://kubernetes.io/blog/2024/08/13/kubernetes-v1-31-release/

Dqlite efficiency

We spent a lot of effort in improving the efficiency of the default datastore, dqlite. You will find improvements in the performance of concurrent queries and open telemetry integration.

Important updates

  • helm upgrade to v3.14.4
  • cert-manager to v1.14.5
  • cilium to v1.15.2
  • gopaddle to v5.0
  • falco to v4.5.1
  • cloudnative pg to v1.23.3

Many thanks to our contributors

  • @TecIntelli
  • @jasonumiker
  • @Gayathri-Bluemeric
  • @DLDClodio
  • @stalb
  • @alphayax
  • @o0th
  • @ShrishtiKarkera

microk8s-aws-addons

29da444 on Dec 6, 2023

microk8s-aws-addons

Release/Commit:29da444
DateDec 6, 2023

Up to date
pinniped-rocks

a8d20bc on Jul 23, 2025

pinniped-rocks

Release/Commit:a8d20bc
DateJul 23, 2025

feat: pin k8s-test-harness (#7)

8753654 on Nov 5, 2024

pinniped-rocks

Release/Commit:8753654
DateNov 5, 2024

Changes rock base to bare (#6)

Switching to a bare-based image will reduce the overall image size and reduces attack surface area.

The original Dockerfile uses gcr.io/distroless/static:nonroot, which has only a few packages. We can add those packages and switch to a bare-based image. Additionally, the original image is a non-root image, thus, we should also switch our rock to be non-root.

We can no longer use ensure_image_contains_paths to check if files exist in the rock images, since they are now bare-based. Instead, we can use ensure_image_contains_paths_bare, which checks the image layers instead. Because of this, we need sufficient permissions to check the /var/lib/docker folder.

c5526f5 on Aug 8, 2024

pinniped-rocks

Release/Commit:c5526f5
DateAug 8, 2024

serialized-data-interface

0.3.6 on Jul 26, 2023

serialized-data-interface

Release/Commit:0.3.6
DateJul 26, 2023

build: bump version 0.3.5->0.3.6 (#53)

0.3.5 on Jan 18, 2022

serialized-data-interface

Release/Commit:0.3.5
DateJan 18, 2022

Gracefully handle empty remote app name (#35)

  • Gracefully handle empty remote app name

It shouldn’t ever happen but it seems that the remote app name can be set to blank during a relation-broken hook in some strange edge case which leads to a ModelError during SDI.__init__(). This handles that case more gracefully.

Fixes #34


12 commits
sriov-dpdk-rocks

67daed4 on Jul 23, 2025

sriov-dpdk-rocks

Release/Commit:67daed4
DateJul 23, 2025

feat: pin k8s-test-harness (#13)

0edc9e5 on Feb 18, 2025

sriov-dpdk-rocks

Release/Commit:0edc9e5
DateFeb 18, 2025

chore(deps): update canonical/has-signed-canonical-cla action to v2 (#12)

Co-authored-by: renovate[bot] <29139614+renovate[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>

f460423 on Nov 5, 2024

sriov-dpdk-rocks

Release/Commit:f460423
DateNov 5, 2024

Changes rock base to bare (#11)

Switching to a bare-based image will reduce the overall image size and reduces attack surface area.

The image is supposed to run a script, thus we need a few packages installed.

ddptool is not statically built, so it still depends on /lib and /lib64, which is why we’re adding base-files.

Switch the container user to root. It is supposed to have access to certain host folders through hostPath mounts, and thus, it should be able to modify them (e.g.: create /var/log/sriovdp folder).

We can no longer use ensure_image_contains_paths to check if files exist in the rock images, since they are now bare-based. Instead, we can use ensure_image_contains_paths_bare, which checks the image layers instead. Because of this, we need sufficient permissions to check the /var/lib/docker folder.

Up to date
whereabouts-rock

042aa62 on Jul 23, 2025

whereabouts-rock

Release/Commit:042aa62
DateJul 23, 2025

feat: pin k8s-test-harness (#17)

ffd589f on Nov 18, 2024

whereabouts-rock

Release/Commit:ffd589f
DateNov 18, 2024

Changes rock bases to bare (#16)

Switching to a bare-based image will reduce the overall image size and reduces attack surface area.

The whereabouts image is supposed to install the binaries on the host it’s running on. For this, it runs a bash script, which is why we still need a few stage packages. Note that the helm chart uses pgrep in a readiness / liveness probe.

We can no longer use ensure_image_contains_paths to check if files exist in the rock images, since they are now bare-based. Instead, we can use ensure_image_contains_paths_bare, which checks the image layers instead. Because of this, we need sufficient permissions to check the /var/lib/docker folder.

Adds an extra sanity check during the integration tests, making sure that there is no error reported in Pebble while starting the service.

2fe3070 on Aug 8, 2024

whereabouts-rock

Release/Commit:2fe3070
DateAug 8, 2024

Update pull_request.yaml after KU-119 (#15)

chisel

v1.2.0 on Jun 20, 2025

chisel

Release/Commit:v1.2.0
DateJun 20, 2025

Highlights: this release introduces support for hard links and handling of path conflicts. It also exposes jsonwall and manifest as Apache-2.0 packages, for easier integration with 3rd party CVE scanners and SBOM generators. A new format, v2, is introduced in this release.

What’s Changed

  • fix: wrong help text for version command by @cjdcordeiro in #183
  • chore(snap): rename system-files interface by @cjdcordeiro in #190
  • feat: add support for hard links by @letFunny in #179
  • chore(ci): bump artifact actions to v4 by @zhijie-yang in #193
  • chore(snap): add security advisory and contact email by @zhijie-yang in #192
  • chore: expose manifest reading and jsonwall as packages by @letFunny in #182
  • chore(deps,build,ci): bump Golang to v1.22 by @zhijie-yang in #200
  • feat: add performance testing in the ci by @letFunny in #196
  • chore(ci): bump artifact actions to v4 by @letFunny in #202
  • feat: add support for path conflicts with ‘prefer’ by @letFunny in #201
  • chore(deps): update canonical/has-signed-canonical-cla action to v2 by @cjdcordeiro in #210
  • feat: cannot extract files outside the target directory by @letFunny in #205
  • chore: update Go version to 1.22.12 for security fixes by @nilsdebruin in #211
  • bugfix: revert disabling TopLevelControl by @letFunny in #214
  • fix: ci real archive tests on supported image by @letFunny in #218
  • refactor: simplify conflict algorithm by @letFunny in #216
  • feat: finish support for path conflicts with ‘prefer’ by @letFunny in #204
  • ci: ubuntu-20.04 runner image is deprecated by @letFunny in #225
  • fix: script errors when root is / by @letFunny in #224
  • feat: add support for v2 format by @letFunny in #197
  • feat: update to Go-1.23 by @letFunny in #219

New Contributors

  • @zhijie-yang made their first contribution in #193
  • @nilsdebruin made their first contribution in #211

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/compare/v1.1.0…v1.2.0

v1.1.0 on Jan 9, 2025

chisel

Release/Commit:v1.1.0
DateJan 9, 2025

Highlights: this release introduces support for Ubuntu Pro archives. Copyright files are no longer implicitly installed. There is also a fix for CVE-2024-45337, and a security policy has been added to the repository.

What’s Changed

  • ci: report vulnerabilities and fail on HIGH,CRITICAL by @cjdcordeiro in #152
  • feat: make suites mandatory in archive config by @HadrienPatte in #161
  • feat: support multiple archives with “priority” field by @letFunny in #160
  • feat: support “Pro” archives by @letFunny in #167
  • fix: explicit parents override implicit by @letFunny in #166
  • fix: remove mantic spread tests by @letFunny in #175
  • fix: remove implicit copyright installation by @letFunny in #170
  • refactor(setup): move YAML-specific logic to yaml.go by @letFunny in #169
  • snap: update description by @rebornplusplus in #165
  • fix(setup): add missing “Generate” equivalency by @rebornplusplus in #173
  • feat: add support for “v2-archives” in “v1” format by @letFunny in #181
  • feat: optimize common case of GlobPath by @letFunny in #180
  • fix: tune comment for v2-archives by @letFunny in #184
  • chore: update golang.org/x/crypto by @letFunny in #189
  • chore: add security policy by @cjdcordeiro in #188

New Contributors

  • @HadrienPatte made their first contribution in #161

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/compare/v1.0.0…v1.1.0

v1.0.0 on Oct 7, 2024

chisel

Release/Commit:v1.0.0
DateOct 7, 2024

Highlights: this major release introduces the Chisel “manifest” - a Zstandard-compressed “jsonwall” file generated by Chisel, to record information about the installed slices in the chiselled root filesystem. The new Chisel command info is also introduced in this release. Finally, the Chisel format chisel-v1 is now deprecated.

What’s Changed

  • chore: update spread test to latest release changes by @letFunny in #147
  • chore: update goyaml to latest version by @letFunny in #153
  • feat: parse generate property in sdf by @letFunny in #143
  • feat: internal manifest package by @letFunny in #144
  • chore: publish release checksums by @rebornplusplus in #155
  • feat: add info command by @rebornplusplus in #101
  • feat: create manifest.wall by @letFunny in #142
  • refactor: tune error message for invalid generate value by @letFunny in #162
  • fix: info supports “generate” paths by @rebornplusplus in #163
  • fix: deprecate “chisel-v1” format by @letFunny in #150
  • feat: validate manifest before writing by @letFunny in #159

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/compare/v0.10.0…v1.0.0

rockcraft

Release/Commit:
DateMar 26, 2025

Special thanks to the contributors that made this release happen: @bepri, @erinecon, @jahn-junior, @javierdelapuente, @medubelko and @tigarmo

Full list of changes

  • fix: add missing migrate and migrate.sh @javierdelapuente (#932)
  • build(deps): update all dependencies @tigarmo (#933)
  • docs: enable Google Analytics @jahn-junior (#931)
  • docs: rename ‘about this doc’ → ‘contribute to this doc’ @medubelko (#930)
  • docs: add CONTRIBUTING.md @medubelko (#925)
  • fix: install system packages when running make setup @jahn-junior (#929)
  • test: address a couple of non-flaky spread failures @tigarmo (#926)
  • docs: Incorporate UX feedback into 12-factor tutorials @erinecon (#918)
  • chore: pin all flask versions for osv warning @bepri (#921)
  • docs: exclude reuse dir from search results @medubelko (#924)
  • docs: add ‘about this documentation’ @medubelko (#920)

github-actions-runner

v2.328.0 on Aug 14, 2025

github-actions-runner

Release/Commit:v2.328.0
DateAug 14, 2025

What’s Changed

  • Update Docker to v28.3.2 and Buildx to v0.26.1 by @github-actions[bot] in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3953
  • Fix if statement structure in update script and variable reference by @salmanmkc in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3956
  • Add V2 flow for runner deletion by @Samirat in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3954
  • Node 20 -> Node 24 migration feature flagging, opt-in and opt-out environment variables by @salmanmkc in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3948
  • Update Node20 and Node24 to latest by @djs-intel in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3972
  • Redirect supported OS doc section to current public Docs location by @corycalahan in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3979
  • Bump Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk from 17.13.0 to 17.14.1 by @dependabot[bot] in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3975
  • Bump Azure.Storage.Blobs from 12.24.0 to 12.25.0 by @dependabot[bot] in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3974
  • Bump actions/download-artifact from 4 to 5 by @dependabot[bot] in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3973
  • Bump actions/checkout from 4 to 5 by @dependabot[bot] in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3982

New Contributors

  • @Samirat made their first contribution in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3954
  • @djs-intel made their first contribution in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3972

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/runner/compare/v2.327.1…v2.328.0

Note: Actions Runner follows a progressive release policy, so the latest release might not be available to your enterprise, organization, or repository yet. To confirm which version of the Actions Runner you should expect, please view the download instructions for your enterprise, organization, or repository. See https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/actions/hosting-your-own-runners/adding-self-hosted-runners

Windows x64

We recommend configuring the runner in a root folder of the Windows drive (e.g. “C:\actions-runner”). This will help avoid issues related to service identity folder permissions and long file path restrictions on Windows.

The following snipped needs to be run on powershell:

# Create a folder under the drive root
mkdir \actions-runner ; cd \actions-runner
# Download the latest runner package
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri https://github.com/actions/runner/releases/download/v2.328.0/actions-runner-win-x64-2.328.0.zip -OutFile actions-runner-win-x64-2.328.0.zip
# Extract the installer
Add-Type -AssemblyName System.IO.Compression.FileSystem ;
[System.IO.Compression.ZipFile]::ExtractToDirectory("$PWD\actions-runner-win-x64-2.328.0.zip", "$PWD")

Windows arm64

We recommend configuring the runner in a root folder of the Windows drive (e.g. “C:\actions-runner”). This will help avoid issues related to service identity folder permissions and long file path restrictions on Windows.

The following snipped needs to be run on powershell:

# Create a folder under the drive root
mkdir \actions-runner ; cd \actions-runner
# Download the latest runner package
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri https://github.com/actions/runner/releases/download/v2.328.0/actions-runner-win-arm64-2.328.0.zip -OutFile actions-runner-win-arm64-2.328.0.zip
# Extract the installer
Add-Type -AssemblyName System.IO.Compression.FileSystem ;
[System.IO.Compression.ZipFile]::ExtractToDirectory("$PWD\actions-runner-win-arm64-2.328.0.zip", "$PWD")

OSX x64

# Create a folder
mkdir actions-runner && cd actions-runner
# Download the latest runner package
curl -O -L https://github.com/actions/runner/releases/download/v2.328.0/actions-runner-osx-x64-2.328.0.tar.gz
# Extract the installer
tar xzf ./actions-runner-osx-x64-2.328.0.tar.gz

OSX arm64 (Apple silicon)

# Create a folder
mkdir actions-runner && cd actions-runner
# Download the latest runner package
curl -O -L https://github.com/actions/runner/releases/download/v2.328.0/actions-runner-osx-arm64-2.328.0.tar.gz
# Extract the installer
tar xzf ./actions-runner-osx-arm64-2.328.0.tar.gz

Linux x64

# Create a folder
mkdir actions-runner && cd actions-runner
# Download the latest runner package
curl -O -L https://github.com/actions/runner/releases/download/v2.328.0/actions-runner-linux-x64-2.328.0.tar.gz
# Extract the installer
tar xzf ./actions-runner-linux-x64-2.328.0.tar.gz

Linux arm64

# Create a folder
mkdir actions-runner && cd actions-runner
# Download the latest runner package
curl -O -L https://github.com/actions/runner/releases/download/v2.328.0/actions-runner-linux-arm64-2.328.0.tar.gz
# Extract the installer
tar xzf ./actions-runner-linux-arm64-2.328.0.tar.gz

Linux arm

# Create a folder
mkdir actions-runner && cd actions-runner
# Download the latest runner package
curl -O -L https://github.com/actions/runner/releases/download/v2.328.0/actions-runner-linux-arm-2.328.0.tar.gz
# Extract the installer
tar xzf ./actions-runner-linux-arm-2.328.0.tar.gz

Using your self hosted runner

For additional details about configuring, running, or shutting down the runner please check out our product docs.

SHA-256 Checksums

The SHA-256 checksums for the packages included in this build are shown below:

  • actions-runner-win-x64-2.328.0.zip
  • actions-runner-win-arm64-2.328.0.zip
  • actions-runner-osx-x64-2.328.0.tar.gz
  • actions-runner-osx-arm64-2.328.0.tar.gz
  • actions-runner-linux-x64-2.328.0.tar.gz 9e621cc108bd636eca08a4af31487c40ff82191e8a52a876b008d60e26655926
  • actions-runner-linux-arm64-2.328.0.tar.gz f037e9c5e554df86bf4078fe1d8fa6889b04b2d642ac76155c3f18977f31a7ed
  • actions-runner-linux-arm-2.328.0.tar.gz

Release/Commit:v2.327.1
DateJul 31, 2025

What’s Changed

  • Try add orchestrationid into user-agent using token claim. by @TingluoHuang in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3945
  • Fix null reference exception in user agent handling by @salmanmkc in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3946
  • Runner Support for executing Node24 Actions by @salmanmkc in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3940
  • Update dotnet sdk to latest version @8.0.412 by @github-actions[bot] in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3941

  • @salmanmkc made their first contribution in https://github.com/actions/runner/pull/3946

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/runner/compare/v2.326.0…v2.327.0

Note: Actions Runner follows a progressive release policy, so the latest release might not be available to your enterprise, organization, or repository yet. To confirm which version of the Actions Runner you should expect, please view the download instructions for your enterprise, organization, or repository. See https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/actions/hosting-your-own-runners/adding-self-hosted-runners

Windows x64

We recommend configuring the runner in a root folder of the Windows drive (e.g. “C:\actions-runner”). This will help avoid issues related to service identity folder permissions and long file path restrictions on Windows.

The following snipped needs to be run on powershell:

v0.8.1 on Jan 19, 2024

discourse-gatekeeper

Release/Commit:v0.8.1
DateJan 19, 2024

Fixed

  • Migration error where discourse is in-line with the default branch but the base content tag is behind. This no longer attempts migration and now also moves the tag to the latest commit on the default branch.

5ae1788 on Apr 7, 2025

dcgm-snap

Release/Commit:5ae1788
DateApr 7, 2025

Fix func test (#60)

Github apperently started truncating the output of ps which breaks our test. Using ps -ww ensures that the output is not truncated.

DateJul 4, 2025

2.2.1 on May 21, 2025

charmed-openstack-upgrader

Release/Commit:2.2.1
DateMay 21, 2025

What’s Changed

  • Pin libjuju by @chanchiwai-ray in #626 to fix https://github.com/canonical/charmed-openstack-upgrader/issues/624

Full commit log since 2.2.0: https://github.com/canonical/charmed-openstack-upgrader/compare/2.2.0…2.2.1

2.2.0 on Mar 27, 2025

charmed-openstack-upgrader

Release/Commit:2.2.0
DateMar 27, 2025

New Features

  • Support new upgrades: | From | To | | ————– | ————– | | Jammy/Yoga | Jammy/Zed | | Jammy/Zed | Jammy/Antelope | | Jammy/Antelope | Jammy/Bobcat | | Jammy/Bobcat | Jammy/Caracal |
  • Add sanity check for the “noout” flag on the Ceph cluster before and after upgrades by @chanchiwai-ray in #530
  • Improve cloud verification checks before upgrading by @chanchiwai-ray in #535
  • Display log file path at the end of the CLI output for better visibility by @jneo8 in #542
  • Add squid to list of supported Ceph releases by @samuelallan72 in #565
  • Improve concurrency management for wait_for_idle and implement single-application retry logic by @jneo8 in #573
  • Improve error message for enable version pinning by @chanchiwai-ray in #575
  • Improve message with unsupported channel by @samuelallan72 in #583
  • Improve checking for mismatched unit openstack versions by @samuelallan72 in #585
  • Improve warning message when there are non-empty hypervisors by @samuelallan72 in #599

Bugs fixed

  • Fix archive step to correctly target nova-cloud-controller in control plane by @samuelallan72 in #550
  • Fix upgrade order for subordinate charms by @samuelallan72 in #551
  • Fix waiting for idle when app has no units - now COU will not hang waiting for idle, by @samuelallan72 in #564
  • Fix version map for horizon and Ceph on Caracal by @samuelallan72 in #568
  • Fix supported horizon releases for Antelope 2023.1 by @samuelallan72 in #574
  • Add pre and post upgrade warnings if running Ceph versions are mismatched by @samuelallan72 in #584
  • Add verification to ensure option enable-auto-restarts for RabbitMQ Server is set to False during upgrades, by @chanchiwai-ray in #593

Documentation and Chores

  • Document how to build and deploy the snap by @samuelallan72 in #453
  • Provide a script to watch the COU logs by @jneo8 in #543
  • Update COU docs to include possible upgrade paths by @chanchiwai-ray in #548
  • Update mapping for Ceph on Caracal by @samuelallan72 in #557
  • Remove extra $ from artefact name by @samuelallan72 in #569
  • Add document how to find mysql backup file and print path in output by @jneo8 in #589
  • Add information that SLURP is not supported by COU by @jneo8 in #590
  • Update openstack_lookup.csv by @chanchiwai-ray in #591
  • Improve documentation for nova-cloud-controller database migration steps by @chanchiwai-ray in #592
  • Add verify step for scheduler_default_filters for nova-cloud-controller during antelope to bobcat upgrade, by @chanchiwai-ray in #594.
  • Add Development Guide by @jneo8 in #616
  • Update Contributing Guide from central management in #617
  • Update Security Policy from central management in #606

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/charmed-openstack-upgrader/compare/2.1.0…2.2.0
